title: Can't understand International media's indifference over Kashmir issue: PM
text:
ISLAMABAD: Prime Minister of Pakistan, Imran Khan taking to the social networking website Twitter, said that he was unable to wrap his head around International media’s ignorance of Kashmir crisis, ARY News reported on Friday.

In a series of tweets, he said: “Kashmir is an internationally recognized disputed territory illegally annexed by India with nine hundred thousand troops imposing a siege on eight million Kashmiris.”

I am puzzled as to how international media continues to give headline coverage to Hongkong protests but ignores the dire human rights crisis in IOJK – an internationally recognised disputed territory illegally annexed by India with 900k troops imposing a siege on 8mn Kashmiris — Imran Khan (@ImranKhanPTI) October 11, 2019

Voicing concerns over the situation in occupied Kashmir, he said, a complete blackout of communications is continuing there for over two months with thousands imprisoned including the children and the entire spectrum of political leadership.

Read More: Kashmir Day Being Observed Today In Solidarity With People Of IoK

He said one hundred thousand Kashmiris have been killed in over thirty years

as committed to them by the international community through UNSC resolutions. — Imran Khan (@ImranKhanPTI) October 11, 2019

He added that the Kashmiris are fighting for their right to self-determination committed to them by the international community through the United Nations Security Council resolutions.

Comments

comments
description: Prime Minister of Pakistan, Imran Khan, said that he was unable to wrap his head around International media's ignorance of the Kashmir crisis.
